page.title: 08RELIGION.
page.content: The only churches in the area are Church of England.There was once a Baptist Chapel in Harlestone but this is now disused and has been converted into a private house. The two churches are St.Andrew's in Harlestone and St.Botolph's in Church Brampton.The latter dates from the 14th.century with restoration in Victorian times.It has an ancient coffer dated as early as the 12th.century and the remains of a preaching cross in the churchyard.St. Andrew's is earlier in date also restored in the 19th.century.The lych gate and cedar tree in the churchyard are striking features. The Rev.D.Smith is the rector of both parishes.He lives at Church Brampton. Regular services are held at both churches on Sundays.
